utterance.content: 9 bucks for a straight flush. He's not coming home. Relax. There's nothing in this universe that can't be explained... eventually. Take this game. Only 2 people knew that you wanted in on it. I didn't tell him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson

utterance.content: Your rabbi, guidance counselor, parent... she's not your mom, is she?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Umm... Boyd's getting dressed, he's ready to check out.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He can't check out without your permission.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His sodium level still isn't normal.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: I told him, he said that God said it was ok. He was fine. Could you talk to him?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Tell them my name isn't Wilson.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Most people in your situation just have their careers to worry about. You've got that and divine retribution.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Tell them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell me how it happened, I'll tell them whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She'd had a bad day - pain-wise. Her ride didn't show up to take her home.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. She didn't have any groceries. She was too sick to go out I... figured I could afford... take a half hour and... pick her up a few things and...

utterance.content: Stay and make sure she's ok.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And never leave. You told me you got an apartment, but you moved in with her. You lied to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Tell them!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His name is not Wilson, and he's screwed up worse than I am.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ok, yes, I lied to you. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Half the doctors who specialize in oncology turn into burnt-out cases, but you - you eat neediness.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Lucky for you. Thanks for the game guys, don't think I'll be coming back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're a functional vampire. Sure, you're heroic, useful to society, but only because it feeds you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's nothing worth stealing so don't even look.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't just have a fetish for needy people, you marry them!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.content: You mean it, and then time passes and suddenly they're not so needy anymore. Your fault. You've been there for them too much. They're getting healthy, independent, and that's just ugly. God you must be pissed at God right now for making her all happy.

utterance.content: Because you're being stupid. You know what you're risking by sleeping with a patient!

utterance.content: Oh that's crap! You're not mad because I'm risking my job. You're not even mad because I lied to you, you're mad because I lied to you and you couldn't tell!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, you got me nailed.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, that's why you didn't want me in your poker game. Because when it comes to being in control, Gregory House leaves our faith healer kid in the dust. If a supreme being exists, he can squash you anytime he wants.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He knows where I am.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Think it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. I'll be right there. Jesus is spiking a fever. He's delusional.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Tuberous sclerosis doesn't cause fever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'll drive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pick any random guy off the street, bring him in here, examine him exhaustively and you'll find at least 3 things wrong with him. This kid has tuberous sclerosis - a mild case.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: But his tumors are growing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We assumed that the tumors were growing 'cos he's getting sicker, but he could have grown old and died and never known about them if he hadn't come here. We were looking for something; it's more or less in the right part of the brain. It's like we found someone standing over a dead body holding a gun. We arrested them, didn't look any further. Well sometimes, people really do just stumble into a murder scene.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His fever's 103 and rising. If we don't do anything, he's going to be chatting with God face-to-face real soon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fevers don't come from a long-term underlying condition. He's a garden variety religious nut who happens to have an infection. It's lumbar puncture time.

utterance.speaker: Boyd
utterance.content: No, no, God told me no more of man's medicine. If we have faith in him, he'll make me well.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's just a test; we just want to find out what's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Boyd
utterance.content: God knows what's wrong. God will take care of it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's delirious and he's a minor. This is your decision, not his.

utterance.speaker: Boyd
utterance.content: The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field... which when a man finds he hides… he buys another field…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Buy all the land you want, don't blow your brains out! You're watching your son kill himself! He's out of his mind with fever--

utterance.speaker: Boyd
utterance.content: Dad! If your faith is weak, I will fail. I need you.

utterance.content: I'm sorry; you don't even know what's wrong with him. God knows the answer and I would rather leave it in his hands than yours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson, need you to do your thing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You do know that I don't actually have magical powers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have faith.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Better off trying to slip some antibiotics into a meal...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which antibiotics? We don't know what infection he's got.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Go as broad as you can.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget it; our best hope is your silver tongue.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What if it's not an infection?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Were you not paying attention when I was doing my murder scene metaphor?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What if the tuberous sclerosis IS guilty? It had the guns in its hands, it was standing over the--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It doesn't cause fever.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It causes everything else. What if the fever's the innocent bystander? Fever could have been set off by something he picked up anywhere. Could have been a bug he got here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or a bug he gave here. He gave it to your patient. That's why her tumor shrank; the virus went after the cancer first.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For 200 years, there've been reports of wild viruses that target tumors. Early 1900's, an Italian medical journal wrote up a woman with cervical cancer who was injected with a weak strain of rabies, I've no idea why they did that but her tumor shrank.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think he gave her rabies?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One of the virus types most prone to go after cancer cells is herpes.

utterance.content: Herpes encephalitis. It would fit. Seizure, low sodium, even the blurred vision and it would mean, if you're right, Grace's cancer is coming back. You're not going to be able to convince them. They don't want any more tests. They don't wanna--

utterance.content: They can't argue with the mark of Cain.

utterance.speaker: Boyd
utterance.content: I'm not going to change my mind! No more tests! God knows the way.

utterance.content: Ok, let's start with the shirt.

utterance.content: That woman you helped? You gave her a virus.

utterance.content: She's healed, I have a gift!

utterance.content: Gift is jewelry, socks. What you have is herpes encephalitis. The only way you could have transmitted it is by scratching one of your own sores and touching another person.

utterance.content: No, no, no sores No, my body's clean, they examined me when I came in! No sores!

utterance.content: Herpes hides. You have an outbreak; it goes away, comes back, goes away. Strip! Maybe you didn't have a sore when you came in but you've got one now.

utterance.content: Do you ever wonder why a perfect child of God should feel so desperate to purify his body that he needed to scarf down a dozen gallons of water a day?

utterance.content: Yeah, the hand of God reached into this kid's pants, made him have sex so he could scratch the rash, stick his fingers into some woman's face, give her a few extra months. Come on, he's just another liar and manipulator.

utterance.content: Well nobody's as perfect as you are. It is possible to believe in something and still fail to live up to it.
